Center                                                        search the site                                                                        Washington Place Academic Technology Center      14 Washington Place     Lower Level     212-998-3500           Map >>       Regular Semester Hours      Mon-Thurs: 9:00am-9:00pm     Fri: 9:00am-5:00pm       Sat-Sun: closed         related pages            Software packages available for use at ITS labs        Technology resources available at ITS labs              Access Policy   This center's resources are open to all NYU students in degree and diploma programs, faculty and staff, and Lab Access Account holders. For information about obtaining such an account, visit the ITS Accounts section.    Computer Platforms Available   Windows, Macintosh, and dual-boot Windows/Red Hat Linux    General Resources     Internet access   Web browsers   The Microsoft Office Suite   Laser printing   Lab staff to assist students in the basics of using an ITS student lab and  other ITS resources such as NYU Classes and NYUHome     Specialized Resources     Macintosh OS  Flatbed scanners equipped with film adapters (positive and negative)   Audio, video, and image editing   Web and print publishing     Windows    Language Learning   Nutrition   Statistics   Web publishing       Graphics and videographics resources   High-performance 3-D workstations   Visualization   Expert advice and consultation in the use of these resources      Supported Media     DVD-R/CD-RW   3.5 Floppy disks (Windows only, by request at front desk)      Note : Specialized resources (video, audio, assistive technologies) are available by in-person request. Please stop by the Center to schedule a reservation.    For a complete list of the software applications, hardware, peripherals, and other equipment available at each ITS lab location, see Software packages available for use at ITS labs and Technology resources available at ITS labs .    ITS Video Classroom   Hours are the same as the Center's hours (above).    Computer Platforms Available   Macintosh computers    General Resources      SuperDrive    FinalCutPro    iMovie    Adobe Premier    AfterEffects    SoundEdit    Peak    iDVD    ...and more      Additional Resources     A Dubbing Station for transfers between VHS, Hi-8, Digital 8, Analog 8 and mini-DV and DVCAM   Instructor Station with interactive desktop display      Supported Media   3.5 Floppy disks, DVD-R/CD-RW, Firewire devices, mini-DV, and DVCAM.     Page last reviewed: February 17, 2015

POM & PLACE Program | Education and Training                                        Skip to main content                      Patient Care       Faculty & Staff Directory       Events       Careers       Donate                                                                                                                                                                             Education and Training                                                                                  Home   MD Admissions   Resources   Faculty   Research   Alumni   About                                  Home Resources Diversity Affairs Education                    - A + A                                         Resources        open/close   General Resources     open/close   Student Affairs  Resources   Mentor & Career Advisor Program   Student Activities   International Health Program   Student Health   Master Scholars Program   Master's Programs   Staff & Contact Info   Student Accolades       open/close   Diversity Affairs  About Us   Recruitment   Education  POM & PLACE Program   Pillars   Health Disparities Selective   Gender & Health Selective   Seminars & Grand Rounds     Professional Development   Highlights and Announcements   LGBTQ Resources       open/close   Medical Education  About the Office of Medical Education   MD Curriculum   Clinical Training Sites       open/close   Student Health  About Us   Clinical Services   Mental Health Services   Emergencies   Immunization Info   New Student Info   Visiting Student Resources   Wellness Information   Additional Info   Confidentiality   Staff/Contact Info   Additonal Forms                                                                        POM & PLACE Program                                           The Office of Diversity Affairs participates in structuring and assessing opportunities for students to demonstrate cultural competency within the Practice of Medicine and PLACE. Critical to learning cultural competency is an experiential, hands-on approach in a clinical community setting.      Practice of Medicine     The POM module establishes a patient-centered program and continuity of care forum that will facilitate learner-centered anchoring of mechanisms of disease principles in conjunction with the development of culturally competent clinical skills.      P.L.A.C.E. Program     The goals of PLACE within the Practice of Medicine module are to provide students a clinical site in which they learn about clinical medicine and interdisciplinary care while developing a patient panel that they can follow at various venues overa a longitudinal period.                                                                                        NYU Langone Medical Center       Student Login       Library                 Policies & Disclaimers
